net.sf.wubiq.clients

Class AbstractLocalPrintManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.wubiq.clients.AbstractLocalPrintManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DirectPrintManager, LocalPrintManager

    public abstract class AbstractLocalPrintManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Keeps gathering printer information and reports it to the server. This is the main element of the client. If the connection to the client fails, it keeps trying until the program is closed. As soon as connection is established identifies itself, sends the probable computer name and, if defined, a unique id (UUID). If no unique id is defined, the uuid is automatically generated.
    Author:
    Federico Alcantara

      • isKilled

        protected boolean isKilled()
        Asks the server if this instance of the client should be closed. This will allow for remote cancellation of client.
        Returns:
        True if the server responds that this client is already killed.

      • isActive

        protected boolean isActive()
        Asks the server if this instance of the client should be closed. This will allow for remote cancellation of client.
        Returns:
        True if the server responds that this client is active.

      • needsRefresh

        protected boolean needsRefresh()
        Asks the server if this instance of the client needs to be refreshed with the list of print services.
        Returns:
        True if the printer information needs to be synchronized with the server.

        Communicates with the server using the sub set of direct connection commands.
        Parameters:
        jobIdString - id of the current job.

        parameters - Parameters.
        Returns:
        Response from the server.
        Throws:
        java.net.ConnectException - If it can't connect to the server.

      • directServerNotSerialized

        public java.lang.Object directServerNotSerialized(java.lang.String jobIdString,
                                                  DirectConnectCommand command)
                                           throws java.net.ConnectException
        Communicates with the server using the sub set of direct connection commands. This connection serves the objects serialized ONLY, no encoding is performed.
        Parameters:
        jobIdString - id of the current job.
        command - Direct connect sub command.
        Returns:
        Response from the server.
        Throws:
        java.net.ConnectException - If it can't connect to the server.

      • directServerNotSerialized

        public java.lang.Object directServerNotSerialized(java.lang.String jobIdString,
                                                  DirectConnectCommand command,
                                                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> parameters)
                                           throws java.net.ConnectException
        Communicates with the server using the sub set of direct connection commands. This connection serves the objects serialized ONLY, no encoding is performed.
        Parameters:
        jobIdString - id of the current job.
        command - Direct connect sub command.
        parameters - Parameters. All parameters MUST be serializable.
        Returns:
        Response from the server.
        Throws:
        java.net.ConnectException - If it can't connect to the server.
